It is a brownie topped with vanilla ice cream, whip cream, and a side of chocolate syrup. I gotta say that the brownie itself inundated my senses with a resplendent sweet flavor.

The salad bar is legit. The selection of greens was nice and fresh, different rices and cold pastas to choose from, fruits, nuts, etc. They charge you by weight. I had so much on my plate that I had to take the rest home and was only charged $5 + change. I'm all for a fresh salad bar. I will try opt for one if I'm feeling indecisive on what to order. The rest of the group was pleased with what they ordered, two of which are vegetarian. I do believe they had gluten-free options as well!

I grew up in Urbana and have been here several times for lunch and dinner (hello salad bar!).  BUT, I came home to visit my family this week and was meeting a friend for breakfast.  I searched Yelp for a good place to go on a weekday and The Courier popped up!  I had no idea they served breakfast, but boy am I glad they do!   We arrived at ~7:45am on a Wednesday and there were plenty of seats available.  My mom and I decided to split the Almond French Toast and the Courier Breakfast so that we could get eggs, bacon, and hash browns as well as the french toast.  The French Toast was good if you like almond... my mom said it tasted like a Chinese Almond Cookie, which it totally did, but it was fun to try something different.  Also loved the homemade breads! We got the french toast with sourdough, but my mom also got the honey whole wheat as toast.  On the side we also ordered the maple sausage links which weren't overall delicious, they were a little greasy.  I'd stick to bacon next time.  All around good start to my day and I will definitely return for another breakfast soon!

We hopped on over to the Courier Cafe on a Saturday night to get some ice cream sundae and more.   The building is authentically old and the decor is pretty much 100 yrs old but very clean and interesting.   The service was ok, the waiter forgot to get my drink. But thats ok, they were kind of busy I guess.  The food was totally different scale ... I ordered the skinny dippers following recommendation of another yelper. The skinny dippers are just potato peals (dont mistake them for potato skins, the meatier kind) deep fried and topped with some veggies, cream etc. Its like a heart attack on a plate and the taste wasnt worth the extra grease on the plate.  The sundae was blah, nothing to talk about. Very mediocre.  Over all, if you are a drunk grad looking for a bite late night, this is the place for you.

Visited this place on my last day in Champaign after 5 years ironically although everyone says you should go here at least once.   Went with a few friends for lunch and this cafe has a nice old school vibe to it and even has a really old cash register. I opted to keep it simple and try the Courier Burger. A really simple burger, but it was delicious and the potato wedges were hot and plentiful. My friends loved their meal options including the black bean soup and salad.   Definitely would recommend this place and I wish I could have tried their breakfast options here.

The Courier has a special place in my heart. In grad school, my morning ritual was to head here with the NYT and chill out with coffee and a good breakfast.  Quite a few years later, the place really hasn't changed. Now I've only been here for breakfast, so I can't comment on other foods at other times. But breakfast has always been a win here for me. I think there are some things they can improve on, like upgrade to a more artisanal toast selection. And, disappointingly, the coffee seems to be slightly less good then I remember it from my student days, but maybe that's my fading memory.  The staff are fantastic and friendly and efficient here. The real attraction of course is the place itself...old school wooden booths, tin ceiling, and just a wonderful homey, comfy look all around.  The day this place closes, a part of me will have died.

I've always gone for breakfast and it's usually pretty good. It's hard to find a good breakfast place in C-U!   A few days ago, I went with my friend and our two kids (baby and a 2 year old). I got there and stood at the top of the steps for, no joke, 10 minutes before the host even acknowledged me. But they were swamped and I gave him the benefit of the doubt. I've worked in food service. When he finally asked if I "needed something," I was confused. The sign clearly says, "Please wait to be seated." I told him I was waiting for a table, and he said, "Oh, there's one down there," and pointed towards the kitchen. My friend and I took our seats, and the host brought a high chair. Someone brought us water, and another 10 minutes later, our frazzled, odd server came to our table. She asked if we were ready to order, and we looked down and said, "Well.... we never got any menus...." She came back with the menus, blamed it on someone else, and we ordered our food. Every time she came to the table, she had some sort of snide comment -- maybe she was just having a bad day or that's her personality, but it was annoying. It would have helped if she would have ever brought us refills, checked to be sure we liked our food, asked if we needed anything else. At the end of the meal, she said, "Gosh your table is so quiet," which we both laughed at. How would she know? She never stopped by!  The food, however, was fine. I ordered a Dagwood Sandwich (after the hostess said, "Well, that's a LOT of food," and I politely responded, "OK and I'll also have a side of fries.") I got the sandwich with just mustard, no secret sauce or mayo, and it's was pretty good (it was a tall sandwich). I shared the sandwich and fries with my 2 year old. We had a few fries left over, to give you an idea of how much food it ended up being.  The bill was about $10 -- on the high end for lunch, but considering it was a large lunch, it seems pretty reasonable.  Lunch was fine, but I think I will stick with breakfast at the Courier. They seem too overwhelmed at lunch!
Standard breakfast/light lunch fare. I like the decor ok but the food has never just made me desperate to go back.

Courier is always my go-to place when the lines are really long elsewhere. Their breakfasts are solid - not the absolute best around, but reliably good.  The eggs can be a bit hit or miss, especially if you're hoping for a yolk. The ingredients they use are very good.

We came here while on vacation and the food and service is top notch. We got the Ruben sandwich and the chicken pitas. One with the fries and the other with sweet potato chips. All the items tasted fresh and were cooked perfectly. Also the quantity was more than we expected for the price, the corned beef was piled high and it was really filling. Our server was very nice and quick to help us out. The experience made our trip to Champaign much more enjoyable overall.

The Courier Cafe is still the best place in C-U to go for a salad bar with variety. The atmosphere has a one of a kind, casual, ambient old-timey charm. Now, if they resolve the recent issues with their buns, they will also be in contention for best burger...

Best breakfast in town. I highly recommend the Mexican-influenced breakfast, but it doesn't matter what you get, as everything is great. Their coffee is also stellar.  If you are a history buff, checkout all the cool stuff they have around the place (civil war-era stained glass, an original architectural concept of the 1896 Exposition in Chicago that is believed to be the only copy in existence, etc).

Maybe it's just my taste preference but this place has never really particularly amazed me despite being a local favorite.  The food is perfectly fine but it's stuff I feel like I could, usually, just make at home on my own.  The decor is nice and the prices are great but I never feel the need to go out of my way to visit.

This is a nice cheap place to go if you want a traditional american dining experience. Read the menu, this location has interesting historical artifacts. One of their best features is the salad bar. If you do the math, it's cheaper than going to the salad bar at the grocery store! We come here for our winter salad fix. They also have wonderful ice cream and shakes and lots of vegetarian options. Sometimes the service can be hit or miss but that usually doesn't interfere with our good time.

U of I is our favorite University, we love the football, our whole family has gone there and when we want beer and pizza, Champaign-Urbana is the place to be.  The floors are sticky and the bathrooms gross but Campus abounds in places with Orange and Blue ambiance.  But when we want a good breakfast before the game, a really good burger after the game or an ice cream rush before the drive home, this Illini family heads to Courier Cafe, with nostalgic 70's decor and honest food.    For breakfast, I prefer the Courier, for lunch any burger plus the sweet potato fries and for ice cream, definitely the Misprint Sundae.  If you want fancier, head down the street to its sister establishment, Silver Creek.    For an off campus comfort food experience, go to Courier.  Tell 'em the Chief sent you.

We went to get lunch here on a Saturday afternoon. Waited for about 15-20 minutes for a table. VERY cramped waiting area.   Menu had a lot of options. I went with the "Monkey Stuff" sandwich - this sweet, delectable sandwich of tasty sugary goodness. This sandwich would have been way better had the bread been toasted. By the end I just felt like I was eating a mush of sugar. To counteract this sugar, I also ordered from the salad bar. I liked the layout of the Salad Bar - you pay $0.38 per oz of salad you get, so I had a filling salad to go with my sweet sandwich for only $2.50! Not a very diverse salad bar, but I was fairly pleased.  The other members of my party enjoyed their meal just fine, but we didn't feel this was anything special. The decor of the restaurant is very vintage, so it ;s kind of dark and has a different feel to it. After reading the reviews, I'm bummed I didn't order a milkshake! I don't know that we'd necessarily make a special trip to come back here.

Not sure what the fuss is over this place to me it was nothing more than poorly made basic bar food I had a fish sandwich that was soggy my mom had a fish sandwich which was also soggy supposed to be one of their best sandwiches I won't go back .

Went in for a late breakfast today. Had some fluffy pancakes and sausage links. Unfortunately they must have changed suppliers on their links, they used to be the biggest in town and perfectly cooked. The new ones I had today just didn't measure up, smaller and somewhat over cooked. Looks like I'll test out the bacon next time!

This place had great phosphates. I had the green value one which is roughly lime and lemon soda with some creme. It was roughly 3.00 bucks. We both had the coulter breakfast with bacon and sausage, eggs, hash browns and toast. I would have given this a four or five but the host skipped my name and made us wait instead of 30 minutes about 50 minutes.  My name was never scribbed off the list so I was a bit upset with the unprofessionalism of that incident.

If you care about customer service and being treated respectfully, I would not go there. Servers are extremely rude especially if you happen to go on a sunday and a tall women server with extremely short hair is your server (wish I knew her name). We were there at 11:45 am and apparently they close their breakfast at 11:45 am. Anyway, she said, "I am sorry, lunch menu only" so were like whatever fine. Sat there but then we saw she was serving a breakfast menu to a table RIGHT NEXT TO US!!! When we asked her about it, she was rather rude and told us that they waited 15 minutes unlike us. Anyway, when we said we were here in time, she decided to ignore us and we just decided to leave because we could not bare how rude their servers were. By the way, she never even apologized while we were leaving and just did not care at all.  EXTREMELY BAD SERVICE AND CUSTOMER MANNERISM!    I did not comment on food because we left the place after 10 minutes because they were so rude and inattentive to us. Try SUNSINGER if you have not already, amazing service and delicious food.

Service: 5 Food: 3 Price: 1  I decided to eat breakfast at Courier Cafe last week after reading all the good reviews. I ordered two eggs, sausage, potatoes, small fruit bowl and coffee. The waitress did an excellent job, looking over me just enough without being intrusive. The eggs, over easy, were too easy. The yolk was properly runny, but unfortunately so was the white. Sausages were tasty, but not seasoned enough. The hash browns were good, but could have been crisper. The English muffin that came with the meal was toasted well, but buttered too heavily. The total bill was $11.13, so plus the tip, my breakfast cost over $13.00. Next time I'll check the prices on the menu, I just assumed that they were in line with other breakfast eateries. I would give this place two stars if the service had not been excellent.

Went last night after a movie for a snack and desert.   We had the desert dippers and a brownie sundae... I loved the atmosphere, love the staff, and lovedddddd the food.   Plus, they have Green Rivers.   What more can you ask for? I mean really.   Definitely check this place out if you're visiting Champaign.

This is the place I take everyone that visits me from out of town. It's delicious for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and it's cheap, so price is never an issue.   The burgers are great, the breakfasts are delicious, but that's not the reason I'm here so often.  The real reason is the Chocolate Egg Creams.   For those of you that aren't familiar, the chocolate egg cream, originating in New York (as far as I've heard), contains milk (not cream), chocolate syrup, and seltzer. That's right, no egg. The egg creams at Courier are delicious, however, you should all know, they are NOT authentic egg creams as they contain egg whites to help the top foam up.   At any rate, very few places these days have egg creams, so it's great that this place still does. (But if nowhere near you has them and you want to try, they're way easy to make. My version: Fill a glass 1/3 with milk, add syrup til liquid height is 1/2 up the class, fill the rest of the way with seltzer, stir, taste, add more syrup if you wish!)

Corned Beef Hash and Eggs is the house specialty I'm told and it didn't disappoint. Also friendly house staff, you will always feel like family in this place. Just a quaint respite from the days travels ahead.

My husband and I were in town to see his parents and Sunday morning we drove here to meet up with my teen stepson.  My husband chose this place because he had been here many times during his college days.  He said it hasn't changed a bit.  We had excellent service, and outstanding food.    I always appreciate restaurants that offer vegan or vegetarian choices.  I was able to get "The Courier Breakfast" (2 eggs, bacon, ham, or sausage, served with hash browns and your choice of toast) with vegetarian sausage patties.  My eggs over easy and German Rye toast blended well with the patties, and the hash browns were perfectly browned.  Add a small grapefruit juice, and bottomless coffee and my meal was just what I wanted.    I wanted the Almond French Toast too, but had to pick only one meal.  I'm not in the area often, but I would definitely come back.    I loved their selection of kids's book (see photo) if you have a child that needs occupied at the table.  There is also plenty of parking, both in the lots next to it, and across the street.

Courier Cafe is a place of the locals.  Which was the main reason my husband and I visited the breakfast spot in early spring.  We wanted to eat something homemade and different (and not occupied by college students), but our experience was just on par.  The ambiance of the place is that straight from a vintage movie.  We waited a while to be seated even though many of the tables were unoccupied (possibly because the host was also the cashier ringing people up as they finished their meals).  As soon as we were seated, I quickly noticed that some of my silverware had dried food stuck and even my elbows stuck to the sticky table.  We ordered the steak and eggs, which lacked seasoning.   The service wasn't too bad.  We had a very friendly waitress, who tried her best to ensure we would enjoy our experience.

I came here because of the good reviews. Right now it's not even that busy, but I've waited for my hamburger for over 40 minutes now. The waitress is attentive and nice (thankfully) but I will probably not end up returning. Will probably edit and change it into 3 stars if the hamburger is phenomenal.
Salad bar is good and cheap.  I wish they had more vegan options on their menu.

I've only had breakfast here. I am giving them four stars for two main reasons: the best biscuits and sausage gravy in town and a stellar breakfast burrito. In fact, I won't order B&G anywhere else.  I highly recommend the biscuits and gravy with extra sausage and an egg on top.  That said, the gravy has more sausage than any other in town. It is also made in-house (one of the servers informed me of this).  I also get their Cha-Cha-Churritos sometimes.  Simply put, this is one of the best places in town for breakfast.

I would give this place a 3.5 stars. Their pastrami sandwich was good and the bread was very fresh but price was a little steep compared to their burgers. Their hand-dipped shake was awesome, so much better than Steak & Shake. They even gave us the extras in another cup. Great service too!

I feel like Mugatu (played by Will Ferrell) in Zoolander (watch, it's only 5 secs of your life): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AG7LjVCj50Y. I am SO SURPRISED by the reviews here! Did I come on a bad night?! This place was seriously bad!  I went there with a bunch of friends and it was just underwhelming. Given the lack of customers, service was pretty slow. There were only a few menus for us to look at, and the ones that we got were covered with crayon and torn-- but the waitress was nice.  My friends got the gazpacho but they said that it was fermented (i.e.,  old). I tried it and thought the same, WTH?   I got the Courier burger-- simple bacon cheeseburger with fries. The burger was huge but it was extremely dry like sandpaper. I hate putting ketchup and mustard on a  burger, but I had to just to get the moisture back in my mouth! The fries are NOT fries, they're potato wedges. Have you ever been to Mcdonalds? Fries should look and taste like that. Com'on.  I then got The Headliner (two scoops of ice cream with fudge, peanuts, whip cream and a cherry). It was okay, but nothing spectacular-- Joe Schmo who lives out in the dumpster could've made it...probably faster too. Given that we were one of the few groups in the restaurant, it took way too long to make it.   Courier Cafe is overrated.

Other than ZAS this was my favorite place to eat! They have the best food in town! The pesto pizza was amazing and so are the milkshakes. I would agree with Ellen that there is a lot of comfort food here. There is almost always a wait to get in here but it's well worth it. They also have a great salad bar that you can create your own salad and then pay per pound. It's amazing.

Ordered salmon with vegetables.  Dinner rolls listed as part of dinner. Salad bar and offered as a side.  Salad bar was closed.  Thought there would be a dinner roll coming.  Was told that since there was no salad bar I was not entitled to dinner rolls.    Blackened Salmon n steamed Veges were good. Had to repeatedly ask for coffee and water refills.    First trip here was much better.  Second one won't have me coming back.

The third Wednesday of the month, the Champaign Urbana Beer Club meets at Crane Alley. As we had eaten there in January, we decided to try something near there, as I have never been here, it worked well for "We haven't eaten here on Wednesdays".  I ordered the steak, Kridz got pork tenderloin.  The meal was served with soup or salad, we both took the soup option, her chili, me cream of mushroom.  I would normally expect to be given a cup of soup as the pre-meal ... thingy... but, this was a massive bowl of soup. If I wasn't hungry, this could have been a full meal unto itself.  The steak was really good. Kridz didn't quite like her pork. The sauce was listed as a pineapple bourbon glaze, but it really just seemed like barbecue sauce. I got no bourbon, or pineapple. Not sure what was up with that.  The prices here are amazing. Cheap is a bad word. This place has VALUE.

I recently went to courier cafe to try out their special, catfish sandwich. I love catfish sandwich, so thought why not try it here. It was a Thursday special, so I went there with my hubby. We were seated immediately. We both ordered catfish sandwich and a brownie special. Our server was really sweet. Food came fast. It looked good. Onion rings tasted great But I had not come there for them :). Unfortunately, the batter on my catfish was not crispy, it was somewhat soggy. It was a pretty thick fillet for me. The quantity was huge. The soggy batter and lack of seasoning made me stop eating after few bites. Now, coming to brownie. It was good. Is it something I would come again for? Well, no. Overall, a mediocre experience.

This is a nice little quaint place located in Urbana. It has an old school feel... Taking you backwards in time! The service is fantastic! Our waitress was attentive and kind. We came during lunch time so I decided to order the regular race burger. No cheese or other toppings. It came with lettuce, pickles, tomatoes, onions and I got sweet potato chips as a side. The chips were delicious! The burger was very overcooked and dry. The bun also tasted really tough. I did not enjoy the food as much as I hoped for! I've heard the brunch is delicious but the burger was just not prepared well.

Ok diner with a limited menu of mostly sandwiches. I tried to order lasagne but they were already out...at 6pm. Poor planning/ordering. Had a tuna melt instead and nothing special. Salad bar is also just ok. Something my grandparents would have thought swell back in the day. Cute space but awfully dark. Prices are cheap and hours are long. Ice cream dishes and phosphate drinks look good, though.

I've been here twice for breakfast and both times I've had a wonderful experience. The wait is never long and the waitresses are always very friendly. The coffee is a bit watered down but there's free refills so it is what it is. I personally really like the courier water (it's basically soda water) I've gotten the steak and eggs, pancakes and eggs, potato pancakes, and Corned beef before. Out of the 4 dishes, I would recommend the corned beef the most because it was something I've never tried and it was a good discovery. I like the potato pancakes at the original pancakes a little bit better. The parking lot provided by the restaurant was full the first time we came so we had to part across the street at the meters so that was a little bummer. Overall the food is okay but i really like the environment and the water. They have this really cool gum ball machine but it's kinda broken so you would have to ask the hostess for a gum ball. I know they have a salad bar that u pay by weight but I've never been here for lunch or dinner yet. I've seen people come here for desserts and shakes but perhaps another time

Courier has been around a long time. I know them mostly for their sandwiches, shakes, and soups. They make some really good beef and chicken chili. Their sandwiches can be a little on the small side. In a recent trip back, I ordered a corn beef sandwich, and i thought it was a little light on the meat from what I remembered a few years ago when  I went to school at U of I. That being said, it did taste good. The meat was not dry and it had good flavor, but nothing spectacular. The waitress was courteous and attentive.   Still a great place to grab a bite in downtown Urbana.

Eh...Decor is a turn-off. I understand the antique-homey kind of feel that this place was going for, but...it ended up just seeming dirty and in need of some updates.  As for the food, it was average...nothing great. It's pretty telling if I can't even remember what I ordered; it's that forgettable.   And holy cow, the waitress was beyond cranky; she was rather rude and inattentive.  Considering this place is one of the only palatable-breakfast places in the area, I splurged to give Courier 2 stars, although I probably will not be coming back.
This is a really cute place.  The food is always tasty and well priced.  Lots of options for everyone.  I also am a huge fan of their salad bar.  I highly recommend this place.
Ordered To-go.   Had to wait a long time to get two sandwiches.  I estimated the wait to be 30 minutes.  The food once we got it was just OK.

One of my favorite places to take guests from out-of-town. They make a mean milkshake for starters. Their burgers are great and they always taste great with their sweet potato fries (which I got serendipitously and have liked them eversince). I enjoy the decor and all of the fascinating objects in the building and I like how they provide a description of each memorable item on the back of the menu. The service is always been great and they always provide an excellent experience. The parking (east of the cafe) never is a problem so that is indeed another plus.

We had the brownie special sundae! It was so delicious! Generous portions of vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, nuts, and a warm brownie on the bottom. It looked so appetizing that we had it before going to dinner! Glad we did! Will definitely be coming back!  Our waitress was awesome! She was really nice and honest! The best part of our experience was the hospitality of the staff! It's so hard to come by restaurants that treat their guests with such respect. Must visit!

The building has a long history and lots of character. It's plenty crowded at Saturday breakfast, a good sign that the locals like it. I enjoyed my whole wheat french toast, and thought the coffee was good. There's a metered parking lot just across the street east, free nights and weekends.

Wonderful themed joint with good food, late hours for a restaurant, delicious milkshakes, and wonderful service. Emily was great, got all seven of our orders straight and out quickly and together. She also asked preemptively if we wanted split checks and took care of closing out all our separate orders smoothly and quickly. We stayed till midnight when they closed, which was a great option to have after having finished playing next door. We'll definitely return next time we're in Urbana.

Great American food place. It's quiet enough to talk with ease and the tall booths provide privacy. The milkshakes and brownie special are divine, and you can always count on the burgers. Their fries are also great- wedge style without being too starchy and without sacrificing crispiness.

I come here every weekend for my breakfast.    The hosts are always hustling.  And I mean hustling.  This place gets busy.  I stood around for like an hour observing and as busy as it was I saw this one server standing against the wall (maybe he was being trained). I don't know if the break down in service is in the kitchen or the wait staff.  I like this place.  They are nice to me and they make my omelet like I like it.

I ate here with my family Sunday morning around 9AM. There were a handful of seats available but I knew it would fill up soon as it normally does on the weekends. They provided us a booster seat for our 20 month old and crayons w color sheets for our 3 year old. My husband and I ordered the same meal, the Courier breakfast (2 eggs over medium, bacon, extra crispy hash browns and a cross ain't; my husband got their delicious biscuit). We got the basic breakfast for the boys to split and they devoured their food. We got milks for the boys and probably could've bought a few gallons at the grocery store for the same price. Next time we'll just bring their bottles. The service was excellent; Jessica came to our table frequently and was efficient.

Went to have lunch at the "trendy" PizzaM and it was full of students on computers with no place to sit and didn't feel like a lunch spot, so walked over here and it was perfect. Everyone loved the burgers, dipper apps, soup and BLT sandwich. Would definitely come back to this little place, however it is a little loud.
Pleasant staff nice food.  Usually the first place I mention if someone is visiting town and wants to eat at a local restaurant.

Best breakfast in CU.  The Courier breakfast is fantastic, especially with the sausage links, which are essentially English bangers.  Delicious.  When anyone visits town, I make a point to take them to Courier because it is such a good representation of what CU has to offer.  The coffee selection is almost always great, and service is typically delightful.

I still love the restaurant. It has its history. What's knocking a star down is the slow and sometimes indifferent service on repeated visits. Today I went with my family for lunch and waited an hour for a quesadilla, a burger, and a sandwich. The party of ahead of us had already left the restaurant by the time we got our food. They seem short staffed on servers and I'm assuming the kitchen got backed up, too.

The food is still good, but the service has gone downhill.  When I walked in, the hostess acted as if I was an inconvenience.  After I was seated, I placed my order, a sandwich and drink.  I had to remind the waitress to bring my drink, and the silverware was dirty, prompting me to ask for a clean knife.  Since the silverware is rolled up in napkins, it appears that staff either doesn't pay attention or doesn't care.  I'll try this again later to see if the service improves.

Ate here a couple of weeks ago. Had an omelet that had way too much green pepper and mushroom and not nearly enough cheese and onions. And on top of that the whole thing tasted like old olive oil. Toast seemed to have never been buttered. The potatoes were OK as was the coffee, but after making an effort to come here as a treat, we were severely disappointed.
